comments.commentBody:
.
Krozel changed her name. And I don't see a Chicago connection. And when will Yeoman Rand get a chance?!

But good pick. Wednesdayish.
Great blend of flavors and textures. Two of us finished nearly the whole salad. I made it a bit early and it held very well, as Ms. Shulman noted.
Obviously it is the republican party's fault since the economy is obviously getting better.  I think it is called truthiness.

No it's not a party they need to vote for it's Sanders regardless of if he wins the nomination it's time to send a message and put a progressive in office.

Voting for either Clinton or Bush is a vote for the current state of the economy and trickle down economics it's time people got a clue and didn't just take the gruel that is being served thinking there is no choice.
If 63% of those polled say the country is off track and 66% say the economy is getting worse, I would ask whose fault it is. That should give you a clue to which party to vote for in 2016.
Can you tell me why Democrats cannot turn out to vote?

The polls don't mean much until Hillary is lined up against Jeb Bush - who will be the nominee after Republicans finish their little game of pretend to corral the gullible tea partiers.

At that point it's just about Dems turnng out to vote.
When speaking Italian, use the Italian names.  When speaking English, use the ? Italian names?  Why!?

Back during the dot com boom in 1999 and 2000, I was brought to California by a PR firm who wanted me to work with "young companies with potential."

I worked for about 15 companies. Only one survives (and is very successful) today. I turned down a company because they had money but no product and no ideas. They had raised $15 million (yes, that's a real number). The company was two recent Stanford grads - who wanted to build websites for other companies. The only problem was they had no idea how to do it.

It was a crazy time back then. Companies like Secret serve as a valuable reminder that not all the wackiness is gone.

John Townsend -
You're starkly unaware of the mindset of your opposition. Read some US history, half the country has been freaking out the other half for the whole time this place has been a country. Your outrage is naive.
If your ancestors emigrated to the US, you are a hypocrite.
She lost me, on Amnesty.

Can you think of anyone who has been effective about Radical Islam other than Saddam Hussein, who kept a tight (and repressive) lid on all of them?  Or Russia?  As far as the other complaints are concerned, they are unfounded speculation.  She would be a perfect president in our time, on a par with Angela Merkel.  Would you prefer Fiorella, Cruz (Ha!), Bush III or Rubio?

Christ also threw a lot of money changers (bankers) out of the Temple and said do unto other as you would do unto yourself. Maybe we should scrutinize some of the Republican rhetoric on the Christian right.
The Times is not adopting the name in a foreign language, I think.  They are taking the supposedly preferred local spelling in English.

As I have written before, I have a CO2 only prediction algorithm, decade by decade, with a single parameter adjusted by the existing records of CO2 concentration and global temperature since 1880 CE. The next prediction is for this decade, not over until the 2019 CE temperature data is in.

This prediction is for lots hotter than the 2000s, equipped with calculated error bars.

I will let everyone know the outcome in early 2020 but it did very well in postdicting that decade.

If the Republicans had their way, not only would witch hunting become popular again (because of Hillary), our economy would return to the barter system and our schools would be teaching our kids that earth was made flat 6000 years ago.
I thought it was easier than Tuesday. Had never heard ladino. Enjoyable puzzle, figured out the diamond pretty early, so that helped.

No, let's look at the Bush Administration, since you are obviously Republican-- lying to get us into a war which left hundreds of thousands dead, sanctioning of torture, Cheney enriching his war profiteer buddies. I think that defines lying and self- serving.  The findings of several panels found no evidence of wrongdoing on Benghazi, even a Republican-led panel. And if you think Hillary Clinton is a left wing radical, your definition of a conservative must be Adolf Hitlet.
A great dish! I used a veggie "bacon" and cut the vinaigrette in half and it turned out fine.
Dolan *gives* a second chance?  He doesn't deserve one himself!!

"James Dolan, who has just cemented his legacy as the all-time stupidest owner in the history of sports."

Couldn't agree more.

There simply can't be more evidence at this point that James Dolan is just unfit to be an owner, be it WNBA or NBA. Of all the available, qualified candidates he might have hired, he chooses Isiah Thomas? To run a women's basketball team? With his history?

As president of the team, you can be sure that Isiah will be down in that locker room, and I can't imagine anything more creepy than that. Isiah Thomas should be out of basketball entirely, and so should James Dolan, who has just cemented his legacy as the all-time stupidest owner in the history of sports.

This may not sound  very nice , but doing a complete investigation of Dolan, his business, and personal life is the only way the Knicks will be saved. Hire P.I.'s, let them dig up the dirt and after the information is found,  have Dolan be forced out of sports. Wear body wire's , whatever to get the information you need. This sounds so terrible what I am suggesting but I am afraid this will be a long , bad ride with the Knicks for a long time if he is involved.

Thomas has been a failure since he retired as a player.  He failed in Toronto; with the Knicks as coach & GM; he owned the Continental Basketball Assoc. which filed for bankruptcy, probably with the help of David Stern so he could form the developmental league for the NBA.  With a track record like that, Dolan doesn't have a CLUE as to which way the wind blows and has the wool pulled over his eyes.  I see no winning future for the Liberty.  Don't buy tickets,  save your money.

There should be a book titled "The Ever Faster Move Toward Sensationalism in America".

Sensationalism leads to conspiracy theories and all types of questionable and paranoid behavior.

"...The tabloid industry began in earnest in England and tends to emphasize topics such as sensational crime stories, astrology, gossip about the personal lives of celebrities and sports stars, and junk news. Often, tabloid newspaper allegations about the sexual practices, drug use, or private conduct of celebrities is borderline defamatory; in many cases, celebrities have successfully sued for libel, demonstrating that tabloid stories have defamed them. It is this sense of the word that led to some entertainment news programs to be called tabloid television. Tabloid newspapers are sometimes pejoratively called the gutter press..."

"...the first Viscount of Northcliffe made his publishing fortune with an empire that rescued failing newspapers and transforming them into pop culture news tabs that he used to influence public opinion and bring down institutions..."

The advent of Radio, then TV, and now the internet and smart phones, let's sensationalism spread even faster. Many people love sensational stories. And many people love to create, embellish and repeat, ridiculous and paranoid stories.

'th' is indeed the standard transliteration of the second consonant in Kathmandu, and Kathmandu with an 'h' is the standard spelling used by most people to refer to the city in English.
As people named Thomas, why would we think its a good idea to go around making up our own spellings just because the one that exists doesn't seem phonetic?

@Tom Kathmandu: No one is discussing making up spellings. The spelling Katmandu has been widely used for decades. It was the standard spelling in all sources I read for several decades, except old ones, until just this year (or so). Let's stick to the subject.

By the way, in case you didn't know, "Thomas" has a pronunciation universally known to native English speakers. "Gillian" on the other hand is usually mispronounced in the U.S. It's also spelled "Jillian" here, but not (I believe) in more British countries like South Africa.

@Tom of Kathmandu:  I apologize for the sarcasm.  But I don't get what you meant about making up our own spellings.  "Katmandu" is not an example.  Neither is "Tibet", which appears to be a similar case.

And we spent the whole twentieth century getting rid of phonetically misleading spellings like "Thibet" and "Kathmandu", where the "th" is naturally pronounced by English speakers as it would be in English. That pronunciation is wrong. The people of India and Nepal know that the "th" is just an attempt to render in English the aspirated dental stop (which is normal in English anyway) as opposed to the unaspirated dental stop, which they would spell "t" and which doesn't exist in English (except as a phonetic variant in certain contexts). Native speakers of English don't know that, so they will mispronounce "Thibet" and "Kathmandu" much more than they would if we left out the "h".

It's too bad. Maybe the advice of Nepalis and Indians on English is not the best authority. (There is nothing specific to Nepal or India in this. It applies even more so to Chinese and also to all other non-English languages.)

There is no way I would vote for the lying, corrupt, egotist HRC. No way. Nader was an actual public servant, unlike any of the narcissistic candidates the Dems put up. Maybe Dems should entertain the idea that THEIR candidate is the "spoiler" because that is the way many of we who can think for ourselves see it.

I voted for Kerry and Obama, the two clowns who called Ed Snowden a traitor and coward. Based on that, I will never vote for a mainstream Dem in nation wide elections again. The Dem elite (including HRC) have demonstrated that they have absolute contempt for our Constitutional rights, as well as being war criminals of the stature of the Bush criminal gang. That's a choice? Only if you are immoral.

I am ashamed of THOSE votes for Kerry and Obama. Sorry Dims, I reject your party and your spinelessness. Put up a decent candidate and I will vote for her (as I did for a woman in 2012, Dr. Jill Stein, Green Party). Otherwise, suffer the consequences. If you think that progressives have "no where to go" you are mistaken. We've had it with Dem hypocrisy.

We wanted Nader, a true progressive and public servant. Gore was the "spoiler" as HRC will be. We just have a higher standard for our candidates than you do. And we will no longer let the elite, corrupt Dems leverage us with a threat.

HRC can raise all the money she wants, but she cannot buy m vote. If the Dems want to commit suicide by Hillary, that is their choice. But too many of us are now energized by Bernie Sanders joining the race, and if he doesn't win the Dem nomination, many of us will vote third party, write in or not at all. The Dems will call us "spoilers", but I reject completely reject that, and them. The spoilers are the bought and sold candidates of both major parties. Someday the great unwashed will wake up and realize that. I am not hopeful though, the ignorance of the electorate is vast, and deep.
Never had chicken breast done this tender. Quite quite tasty.

Susan, doesn't "Roma" mean (the people formerly known as) Gypsies?

Okay, it's a weak attempt at humor. But Roma is not English for Rome.
